CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 5, 1955, pg. 5, reads: "Centre Avenue Landslide - Hundreds of pounds of earth and concrete retaining wall, apparently loosened by the thawing earth, on Tuesday shortly after noon, rolled against this section of the Lillian Apartments, 2841 Centre Avenue. John Bronson, janitor at the apartments, escaped a possible death by a few seconds.  Bronson was bringing rubbish from the house to place in a disposal located where the slide is pictured when he heard a 'rumbling noise which sounded like and earthquake and shook the building.'  The slide dented the side of the building as pictured. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Man and two boys, including one on left wearing jeans, cap, and eyeglasses, looking at collapsed fence and wall, beside beside Lillian Apartments building, 2841 Centre Avenue, Hill District
